review_title: King of Battery Life with Great Sound (Value for Money!)
review_comment: I've been using the boAt Nirvana Zenith Pro and I'm genuinely impressed for the price. The biggest win here is the battery lifeâ€”it seriously lasts forever. You can go days without worrying about charging the case, which is a huge plus. The sound quality is fantastic if you like a strong, punchy bass. It's perfect for pop, hip-hop, and watching movies because the Spatial Audio feature makes everything sound immersive. The Active Noise Cancellation (ANC) works very well for blocking out sounds like fans, A/C, and general indoor chatter, making your commute much quieter. The only real downside is the ANC struggles a bit with loud, sudden noises outdoors, and the system voice announcements are quite loud. Verdict: If you want incredible battery life, heavy bass, and good features like ANC and LDAC without spending a fortune, these are a top choice. Great value for money!

review_title: Nice product, do give it a try!

Solution - 1: Either you remove all the letter then it would look good as nirvana is engraved on the case where the letters stick. Solution - 2: Or apply feviquick with the help of a needle and stick the letters again and it's never gonna get off ever again. My final recommendation to you would be that if you fix the minor con than the product is great.

It has an impressive Mike- that captures your voice.. Yet they cannot catch the low intensity voice. Some drawbacks and suggestions. 1. There is no problem with the air clips but the case has its own problems- like it does not show how much battery is remaining in it. 2. The magnets are loose so one needs to adjust the airclips inside the after placing them. 3. The airclips get automatically connected with the device even when they are inside the case and the case is in your pocket!-because the magnets are loose! 4. As the case is tiny, it's power backup is less. (The battery's shelf-life also seems to be less.) Else all is fine.. A recommended product for the people like me whose ears do not accept the regular ear buds. 6. Has a weak connection capacity. review_title: My Review of Noise Pure Pods (Power Black)
review_comment: I bought these earbuds yesterday, and honestly, Iâ€™m super impressed with them so far. ðŸ”‹ Battery Life: The claim of up to 80 hours seems true â€” I used them almost the whole day, and the battery barely moved. Thatâ€™s a huge relief compared to my old earbuds. ðŸŽ¶ Sound Quality: The 16mm custom drivers make a real difference. The bass feels punchy, vocals are clear, and the overall balance is perfect whether itâ€™s music, movies, or even phone calls. ðŸŽ§ Noise Cancellation: The Environmental Noise Cancellation works well, especially during calls. Even in a noisy background, the person on the other side could hear me clearly. ðŸ’¦ Build & Comfort: The ear hook design (Pure Band) makes them sit securely on the ears, which is great for workouts or biking. Plus, the IPX5 water resistance means I donâ€™t have to worry about sweat or rain. âš¡ First Impression: For something I just bought, the comfort, sound quality, and battery life are way above my expectations. The matte black design also looks very premium. ðŸ‘‰ Verdict (Day 1): Totally worth the price! If they perform this good on the first day, Iâ€™m excited to see how they hold up in the long run.

review_title: Ordered second time, as good call quality and average sound and best battery
review_comment: Product Review for boAt Nirvana Ion True Wireless Earbuds I recently purchased the boAt Nirvana Ion True Wireless Earbuds, and after using them for a while, hereâ€™s my detailed review. Design & Comfort (4.5/5) The earbuds come in a sleek, pebble-shaped charging case with an LED indicator, giving them a premium look. The matte finish on the earbuds provides a solid grip, and they feel comfortable in the ears, even during long listening sessions. Multiple ear tip sizes ensure a snug fit. Audio Performance (4.5/5) The 10mm drivers deliver powerful sound with dual EQ modes â€“ boAt Signature Sound for deep bass lovers and Balanced Mode for a more natural sound. The Crystal Bionic Sound with HiFiÂ® DSP enhances audio clarity, making music and calls sound crisp. Battery Life (5/5) One of the best features of these earbuds is their 120-hour battery life (including the case). Each earbud lasts 24 hours on a single charge, which is impressive. This makes them perfect for long trips without worrying about frequent charging. Call Quality & Connectivity (4/5) The quad-mic setup with ENxâ„¢ technology significantly reduces background noise during calls. The person on the other end hears your voice clearly. The earbuds support Bluetooth 5.2, ensuring a stable connection with no noticeable lag. Gaming & Additional Features (4/5) With a 60ms low-latency mode, gaming and watching videos are smooth, with minimal audio delay. They also feature in-ear detection, pausing playback when removed from the ears, which is a convenient touch. Final Verdict (4.5/5) The boAt Nirvana Ion earbuds offer excellent sound, a stylish design, and an unmatched battery life at an affordable price. If youâ€™re looking for budget-friendly earbuds with premium features, these are a great choice. Pros: âœ”ï¸ Excellent battery life (120 hours) âœ”ï¸ Great sound with dual EQ modes âœ”ï¸ Comfortable fit and premium design âœ”ï¸ Low-latency mode for gaming âœ”ï¸ Clear call quality with quad mics Cons: âŒ No Active Noise Cancellation (ANC) âŒ Touch controls could be more responsive Would I recommend it? Absolutely! Great value for money, especially for music lovers and travelers

First time using any earbud. It was recommended by one of my friend. Ordered it. Was using it for little more than1 hr everyday for last 14 days. Pros: 1. Sounds great. Boat's signature sound which is bass boosted feels great. 2. Boat Hearables app also customizes best suitable audio type only for you with its amazing hearing test. Apart from that you get to adjust your audio on your own. Sound gets 8.5/10 from me. 3. Other side of the phone says crystal clear sound they can hear from me. Works great even in very low tone. Clarity worked damn well even in fish market, traffic, puja pandals with loud mikes. Will rate 10/10 on calling clarity. 4. Great touch features. Next song, previous song, pause, anc mode> anc off> ambient mode, signature sound> balanced sound, call receive and cut etc are smoothy operative from touch features. For volume only you need to open phone. Touch gets 9/10 from me. 5. Charged 1st time and dat was the last time since these 14days. Battery status 100% in both buds and 91% in case. Terrific battery life. Gets 10/10. 6. In ear detection is great. Music/video pause when ear bud is taken out of ear. 7. Fits great in my ear. Does not get loose while running. 3types of rubber is given with the box for your ear type. 8. Ambient Feature is absolutely good thing while you are walking in road or traffic, you need to hear the sourround too. However, it should work with lesser dB sound too. As it seems it working in short distance when the vehile has approached considerably. If it is a truck/bus the noise/horn is louder from long back so you get time to be aware. But if it is a car or bike unless it horns you wont be able to be aware well in advanced. This thing I dnt know may not be expected in this low budget. Even with out the earbuds been connected to bluetooth it reduces the sourrounding sound considerably without ambident mode on. Cons: Just one con I must admit is the Boat Hearable app. It does not work without GPS. However there is absolutely no necessity of this app to be installed if you are pretty happy with the boats signature sound/ balanced sound. Only if you want to customize your auido you need it. Also, you need it if you want to turn on/off the feature for mutiple device connections. Did not use that feature yet. Conclusion: I strongly recommend it. Sounds great for me.

The Nirvana Ivy earbuds offer excellent value, packing premium features like 360Â° Spatial Audio with dynamic head tracking and up to 50dB Active Noise Cancellation into an affordable package. The sound is generally good, with an emphasis on bass, and the 11mm drivers deliver a rich audio experience. Battery life is impressive, offering up to 50 hours with the case and a quick charge feature. While some users might find the fit a bit wide or notice slight distortion at high volumes, the overall package, including IPX5 water resistance and app customization, makes them a strong contender for budget-conscious users seeking immersive audio.

I recently purchased the Nirvana Boat Ivy and have been really impressed with its performance. The sound quality is crisp with decent bass for its size, and it easily fills a room. The Bluetooth connectivity is quick and stable, and I haven't experienced any lag or drops so far. The design is sleek and modernâ€”compact enough to carry around but sturdy enough to feel premium. Battery life is impressive; it easily lasts for hours on a single charge, which makes it perfect for both indoor and outdoor use. One thing I really appreciate is the ease of useâ€”the controls are intuitive, and pairing was seamless. Overall, this is a great Bluetooth speaker in its price range and definitely worth the buy. Highly recommended for music lovers looking for portability without compromising on quality!

The ANC Mode for this earbuds are good and reliable but the overall touch responsiveness and in ear controls are not always on point, in my first day use itself I faced touch issues and when I plug out my earphones the music doesn't stop playing. The head detection and spatial sound feature is really an experience, that's a good feature implemented in these earbudsThe only issue I had is with the touch response and in ear detection. Overall I'll give it a 3.5 out of 5

review_title: Fine, but not great for the price !!
review_comment: The media could not be loaded. This is my Nirvana's 2nd purchase in a row from amazon, earlier bought a Nirvana Ion ANC Pro. While Nirvana Ion ANC Pro excels in audio quality & playtime, it had few issues like: -not fit for workouts/running/cycling, keeps slipping-dropping, tried changing bud sizes, no luck.. -slow connections (sometimes as worse as manually redo unpairing-pairing with devices) -super sensitive touch leading to unintended play-pause triggers....confusing Surprisingly, with Nirvana X -audio quality is great (a notch higher than Nirvana Ion ANC in my opinion) -Nirvana X is amazing for workouts/running, it just doesn't slip at all....big wow for that ! -lightening quick bluetooth connections with devices & multi connections -touch controls are smoother BUT also: -Observed few instances where left ear bud went silent for few youtube videos while right side was ok. And it spooked me particularly when at a time i was using the left ear bud 'only' becoz no audio at all, got me looking over for volume controls, relaunching music....putting the bud back to case and waking it up again...retrying -The other day it started working... seems intermittent so i am kind of unsure what may come further !! -battery back-up is a disappointment ! Ran out on me twice after full charge !! Overall, Nirvana X is a good option among others in this segment but in this price it doesn't sound like a deal-breaker

review_title: Not worthy unless someone gives you free of cost, Do Not Buy... Waste of Money
review_comment: The product build quality is not great. The charging box lid is not tight, it easily opens and the earbuds looks good but when you hold it, it looks cheap. Connectivity is fast, as soon as you open a lid the Bluetooth connects easily to the device. It supports dual connectivity but if it is connected to one device then it takes time to connect the second device sometimes it doesn't connect and then you have to unpair or disconnect with the first device. Second issue I observed is after few hours of listening to movies, games and song the right earbud and left earbud were not in sync. I use to hear song in right ear first and then in left ear. Because of this problem I replaced the product but I found this in second product as well so I returned the product. Third thing I didn't like is it's resetting. In manual it is mentioned how to reset the earbuds but it didn't work for me for both times. I even searched on YouTube on how to reset the noise aura earbuds but couldn't find any video particularly for this product. Noise does not provide extra soft earbuds at this price the competitors are providing extra pair. Bass is ok, don't expect much and noise cancellation is also ok, you can hear surrounding voices at home in full volume when listing songs. In traffic or outside if you are on call then other person will hear surrounding sounds Only one thing I loved is the Battery, it is very good. But noise have to work hard on the product development and enhancement. Touch is good not great and not bad as well. It works. Single touch increases or reduces the volume. When you want to use doublenor tripple touch to change the songs etc then it might not work accordingly. It will keep changing volumes. I didn't like this product. I used two products of noise as initially I thought the first product might be defective but same problem I faced with replacement.

review_comment: Iâ€™ve been using the Noise Aura Buds since April, and I must say, theyâ€™ve been an excellent purchase. Sound Quality: The audio output is impressive â€” whether Iâ€™m listening to music, watching movies, or attending meetings, the sound is always clear and immersive. I rarely have to turn the volume up too high, and the bass feels well-balanced without being overwhelming. Call & Mic Performance: Call quality has been consistently reliable. Voices come through crisp and clear, and even during outdoor calls, the mic captures my voice well without much disturbance. It performs equally well indoors. Comfort & Fit: The earbuds fit comfortably and stay secure even during longer use. No ear fatigue, which is a plus for daily usage. Battery Life: Battery performance is solid. Dual Pairing Feature: One of my favorite features is dual pairing â€” being able to connect both my phone and laptop simultaneously is super convenient, especially when Iâ€™m switching between calls and media. Verdict: For the price, the Noise Aura Buds deliver great value. I don't know the logic behind this. Also voice activated controls are absent.

Recieved the product with no issues. The device is very good and the anc is okay as well. Keep in mind that both the buds and the case is big. Battery like is good as well (8hrs on each bud. Need to charge the case every 1-2 days if you're a heavy user. If you connect via Google quick connect then in the bluetooth settings you can see the battery percentage of each bud. The app is terrible for tablet devices and if you want to change the mode( like from anc mode--> normal mode) when you are using only one earbud, it tells u to connect both buds. Which defeatz the whole purpose of the app because half your controls you wanted to change are on the other earbud. In ear detection is very good Anc mode works well. If you're in a car, the sounds of the road are removed.keep in mind that the anc mostly removes low end so don't expect anything insane

review_title: Waste of money on i spented in it....
review_comment: Very worst customer support and poor of audio and battery backup...only max level volume reach only audio can heared..otherwise not hearing... And very worst there is no app connectivity for this pure pods to customise the sound effects and so on... Even Other brands are giving their app connectivity for an base priced air pods and other devices.... I'm totally frustrated and thinking that why should I bought this... And there is no return and refund on this product .. this makes me very angry on it.... And I don't know where the enc is ? Noise brand you should update urself for good customer feedback back... The design of these earplugs is technically very good. One can use them continuously for 5 to 6 hours without causing harm to their ears. Voice quality good. I bought this item twice.

I always use Boat ear buds. They are the best. Better than Apple AirPods as they go on for days before re-charging needed. Sound quality is very good. 1 star less only because this particular model doesnâ€™t have the battery status feature, which was there in my previous Boat 141 Earbuds. Very happy with Boat otherwise.

I used to earlier use Boat141 earpods, it was an okay product so brought this Boat Nirvana ION earpods, thinking it will be better then Boat 141, but unforunately it is one of the worst earpods i have used. 1. The sound quality was claimed superior, but not much difference in sound quality as compared to Boat 141. 2. There is this feature that turns off the earpods, only way to turn it on again is to put it back in the case and remove it to turn it ON and no feature to disable it (its a painful feature). 3. There is a feature where you remove your earpods from the ears, it pauses the audio (till now its fine) but if you dont put it back on to your ears within 5 seconds, it disconnects the bluetooth and to reconnect you have again remove the case put it back in the case and again put it on to the ears and again connect the bluetooth (so if you are speaking to someone or just remove your earpods hear an announcement in tain and put it back you are gone) . Thankfully they updated the earpods software and gave an optio to disable it. 4. If you switch between two apps like if i am hearing music on amazon music and if switch to amazon prime or facebook and start watching something there and the audio needs to switch, it most of the times disconnects the bluetooth and again you to put it in the case and put it back to connect and many times you have to do this multiple times to connect. 5. If i am travelling and if i tap the earpods to pause or if my hand or someone elses hand touchs my earpods and it pauses audio and disconnects and again to connect back to the phone i have put the earpods back to the case and put it back to connect. 6. If i pause the music on my amazon music app, many times it disconnects the earpods from the phone and again if i have to connect the bluetooth again i have to put it back in the case and again put it back to ears to connect. 7. The touch sensor of the earpods is in between the silver circle on the boat logo which is very sensitive doesnt work incase of a tap and most of the time if i tap and it pauses the audio it also disconnects the earpods and if earpods get disconnected then to connect back i have to put it back to the case and re-connect. 8. Earpods randomly disconnects from the phone and to connect back i have to put it back to the case and reconnect is painful. 9. When i first want to connect the earpods to the phone the bluetooth needs to be first on to be connected if i put the earppods on and then turn on the phone bluetooth it doesnt connect and even in first case where i keep the bluetooth on and then try to connect the earpods it takes multiple attempts to connect the blueetooth to the phone. 10. They have an APP called boat hearables to support the earpods, which pops up whenver I put the earpods on to my ears asking connect the earpods, and when i try to connect the earpods through the APP it trys for 5 minutes and then comes back telling me it cant connect because the phone has not been connected to the bluetooth, so if I have to connect the earpods to the phone manually then only the app will connect to the earpods then why does the APP ask me to connect the earpods to phone when it cannot, when i connect the phone to the earpods manually it should also connect the app to the earpods instead of popping up messages asking to connect the earpods to the APP and then failing to do so. THE EARPODS ARE VERY PAINFULL TO USE, THE BLUETOOTH DISCONNECTS VERY RANDOMLY AND FOR EVERYTHING AND TO RECONNECT PUTTING IT BACK TO THE CASE AND PUTTING IT ON IS PAINFULL TASK CONSIDERING I AND MANY LIKE ME USE THE EARPODS WHILE TRAVELLING IN TRAINS AND METRO AND THERE IS NO FEATURE TO TURN THIS FEATURE OFF.

The buds do have a tendency of falling off the ear but that's purely a me problem and I am sure its a problem with any TWS worth its sound. The 'kitna deti hai' factor with range is good. It does take me from one room to another with no issues. The build quality, naice! boAt has truly nailed the vibe with this one. Plug in, tune out, and float away. ðŸš€ðŸŽ¶

Unfortunately, I made the mistake of trusting this product. The brand boasts about being the best Indian brand, but that couldnâ€™t be further from the truth. They slap high-end terms like â€œANCâ€ and â€œSPATIALâ€ on their products, but itâ€™s all just marketing gimmicks. The so-called ANC is an absolute jokeâ€”you can hear every little sound around you, making the feature completely useless. To make things even worse, their app is poorly designed. Not everyone wears both earphones at the same time, and I often use just one, but the app doesn't even support that. As a result, the sound quality becomes unbearably bad. Itâ€™s frustrating beyond words. The biggest regret? I didnâ€™t just buy oneâ€”I bought two of these useless products. Both have turned out to be a complete waste of money. The sound is terrible, the features are non-functional, and the brand clearly has no intention of delivering quality. All they care about is making money while fooling customers with false claims. This isnâ€™t just the worst TWS Iâ€™ve ever usedâ€”itâ€™s the worst purchase Iâ€™ve ever made.

review_title: Entry level premium segment from boAt.
review_comment: It's been a month using Zenith pro, average fitting and ANC is good, calls are average, Sound quality is subjective, In my experience it's good and performs Great using Spatial mode. Battery backup is on point. Need to improve in call sounding like a call ends from second person, it doesn't make any sound and it would be better if touch sounds are provided, it's not there. Premium look and stem design. Average bass. Need reworks in bass and in-app custom EQ's. Overall it's a bit okeishh and I brought it for 3k, now the price may vary. Not worth for 3k but you can buy it when it drops.

review_title: Outstanding quality and value for money
review_comment: This is definitely good product. I was been using JBL previously bought from Canada. I saw the price of this product lower than JBL. I purchased with an intention to use short term expecting this will not last long. But I now after using for 4 months, I can say this product is top quality than JBL eventhough price is low. Best value for money.

review_title: Not a premium product and no returns/refund
review_comment: This is a public service announcement. Boat doesnt return/refund this product unless it's faulty. In my case, left side seemed to not work intermittently and the buds despite using the smallest buds were painful for my ears. However amazon does not provide a return option on the product and redirects you to boat. Boat meanwhile has a not very friendly user interface to raise issues with your product. They only take the product to technically check your device for faults and does not entertain the satisfaction of the customer. Despite raising the issue on the day of the delivery and giving back a pristine product for the check. They refused to understand that this product can't be used by me due to the ill fitting nature of the buds. A loss of 3k. And honestly not worth it. As you can see from the pictures. The plastic seems cheap and lacks finish. As does the default sounds on pairing up, it is loud and harsh and impervious to volume control. Music plays fine. The features are otherwise as mentioned. But as a customer. The service and lack of clarity on return/refund is infuriating and honestly not something to uphold by a company that prides itself on the Indian market. I believe that a product if it can't be returned should mention that in their policy. The reply from customer service is that return/refund is not mentioned therefore not provided. Obfuscating isn't an answer my corporates. Sincerely, frustrated customer.

Value for money Iâ€™ve been using these earphones for a few days now and Iâ€™m genuinely impressed. The sound quality is crisp, with clear highs and deep bass. Theyâ€™re super comfortable to wear even for long hours, and the build quality feels solid. The mic also works well during callsâ€”no complaints there. For the price, this is a great deal. Totally satisfied with my purchase and would definitely recommend these to anyone looking for a reliable pair of earphones!

review_title: DO NOT BUY!!! Worst product. Worst Support!
review_comment: Product was delivered on the next day. Packaging was good and the Air Clips looked very vey premium. Was very excited to use it. Alas! When you connect your mobile and wear these on your ears, your hands keep reaching your mobile to increase volume. Drastically low volume (even if it is set at highest level). Amazon does not support as there is no damage. Was asked to contact Noise support. Upon contacting them and explaining the troubleshooting steps, The agent asked me to fill out a form when calling "Complaint Registration". She said that it might take a total of 16 Days for a resolution as they will take it to the Service center and then diagnose and later fix it. Had filled this form about 4 Hrs ago and am still waiting on the shipment instructions! What's more- All this on the day of delivery and Amazon does not support this anymore as it is not damaged and seem to be a hardware issue. over 10 years as an ardent Amazon customer to see this kind of "Shrug away" attitude for a loyal customer! Never every buy this product. One will repent for the money spent, Time wasted and the agony of lack of support!

It has superior bass and the build quality is superb. The battery time is also quite good and gives playback time for 2 days straight. I have tried it on streets and in the office as well, the voice is audible to the other person and does not have difficulty in hearing.It is sturdy and anti slip because of the rubber grip in the ear. Great earpods.. and very affordable. ðŸ’¯âœ…

Comparably to oneplus for same price range. It has terrible battery life for both ear buds and case. This was my first purchase of boat. Now i got it ..its a whitelable product probably might cost 500rs or so and boat is reselling them at such price. My suggestion go with One plus for same range. 1.Battery life - For Ear Buds, its hardly 3hr at 80% volume. With 2200 Oneplus, it usually was 6hrs atleast. 2. Battery life - For Case, the case only can charge buds two times and it goes zero. Comparably with ome plus for 2200rs i was able to charge 4times. 3. It has terrible audio mic, means you cant take calls outside as receiver will not be able to listen you. Only good thing is that its size is comfortable with men ears. My suggestion is go with oneplus if you have 2000-3000 budget. Dont waste your money on Boat. In reality its just a 500rs chinese product being resold to indian market. If you have to purchase chinese product then go for a better one. Other pro thing is that it charges quickly but has terrible retention rate.

review_title: Worthy Earbuds for Audio Lovers â€“ Great Value for Money!
review_comment: Iâ€™ve been using the boAt Nirvana X for a while now, and I must say, these are solid earbuds for the price I paid (bought for â‚¹2299 with coupon and bank discount during first sale) Audio Quality: Even though there's no ANC, the audio quality more than makes up for it. The Knowles tuning is a game-changer â€“ far better than the default signature sound. If you're into clear vocals and balanced sound, you'll love it. LDAC support is a bonus, especially if you're listening to high-bitrate tracks â€“ the difference is noticeable! Battery & Comfort: Battery life is impressive and easily lasts through long sessions. The case is slightly bulky with a boxy design, and the earbuds themselves are a bit large, but theyâ€™re still quite comfortable and fit well in the ears. Features: Dual pairing works smoothly, and switching between devices is convenient. No connection issues so far. Overall, if you're an audio enthusiast looking for great sound and features like LDAC and dual pairing (and can live without ANC), these are totally worth it at this price!
Good quality
Good product

Scam. I recently purchased a product that seemed to be a knockoff or imitation of the Huawei freeclip which is around 13000rs. Unfortunately, within just the first three days of use, one of the two units stopped working completely. I attempted to contact Amazon for support, but I was informed that the item is non-returnable, and so far I havenâ€™t received any helpful response or resolution from their end. This has left me in a very frustrating position. I spent my hard-earned money on a product that failed almost immediately, and now I feel stuck with a defective item and no clear way to get support. The listing did not make it clear that the product was non-returnable, nor did it provide any accessible information about how to claim a warranty from the manufacturer â€” if one even exists. At this point, I just want to know how I can get help â€” either through a warranty claim or some kind of replacement or refund process. Itâ€™s disappointing to experience this kind of service, especially when all I did was trust the product listing and make a good-faith purchase.

review_title: Very disappointed with the purchase ðŸ˜ž #Purchase #Disappointment #Shopping
review_comment: Alright, the fit's okay. I had the Huawei FreeClip before, and these Noise Clip 2s feel a bit bigger and different. They seem kinda bulky compared to the FreeClips, which are, like, 11k more on sale, but they're light enough to wear for a while. I wanted clip-on OWS because I wear glasses and have small ears. Other OWS styles don't work with glasses or hurt my ears. Here's what's good: 1. They're light on my ears. Fit is good enough for my small ears 2. The battery's good, lasting about 5 1/2 hours. 3. The case feels light. 4. Call quality is manageable. Only tried it at home.. Here's what's not so good: 1. They feel like cheap plastic for 3.2k. 2. The volume is super low. That's the biggest issue, defeats the purpose of buds. I also have Truke Liberty OWS, which cost less than half the price. Truke sounds better and louder. I'm really bummed about the sound on the Noise Clip 2. It makes me regret buying them. They sound okay inside the house, where it's quiet (people can easily hear what is playing). You can barely hear anything if people are talking around you. Outside, they're pretty useless. You can barely hear anything, even at full volume. 3. No app from Noise. For 3.2k, they should have basic settings through an app. 4. The gesture controls are weird. Triple tap to play/pause, double tap to answer/end. The gestures are glitchy. They work sometimes, but sometimes you have to try multiple times. I have Truke liberty Ows, tozo ows and huawei freeclips. Based on my experience with other premium, mid range and entry level ows this is a disappointing buy. I expected at least decent performance for the price. I was busy with other things and missed the return window. Now my 3k is down the drain.
